A Well-organized Family.--The family firm should be well organized. Together the father and mother should consider their responsibilities. Together they should work for the highest good of their children. There is to be no variance between them. Never should they in the presence of their children criticize each other's plans or question each other's judgment. If the wife is inexperienced, she should try to find out where her work makes the work for her husband more difficult as he labors for the salvation of the children. And the husband should 

156 

hold up the hands of his wife, giving her wise counsel and loving encouragement.--RH, July 8, 1902.
